headline: Luxury Sneaker Maker Golden Goose is Ready to Revive IPO When Markets Allow, CFO Says
summary: The maker of Super-Star sneakers is leaving the door open to a listing after shelving plans for an initial public offering last year.

raw.headline: Luxury Sneaker Maker Golden Goose is Ready to Revive IPO When Markets Allow, CFO Says
raw.summary: The maker of Super-Star sneakers is leaving the door open to a listing after shelving plans for an initial public offering last year.

headline: Starbucks rolls out AI for inventory counting
summary: -Starbucks is rolling out a new system for counting inventory that uses artificial intelligence technology to its more than 11,000 company-owned stores in North America by the end of September, the global coffee chain announced on Wednesday.  The system has workers scan inventory shelves with a handheld tablet equipped with software intended to automatically count goods and flag those in low supply.  Starbucks Chief Technology Officer Deb Hall Lefevre said in a statement that the system enables faster replenishment and more consistent availability of in-store items, such as cold foam, oat milk and caramel drizzle.

headline: Starbucks rolls out AI-based inventory counting technology
summary: This latest employee-facing automated technology from Starbucks allows baristas to count inventory eight times more frequently

raw.headline: Starbucks rolls out AI-based inventory counting technology
raw.summary: This latest employee-facing automated technology from Starbucks allows baristas to count inventory eight times more frequently

headline: NomadGo’s Inventory AI Brings Automated Counting to More than 11,000 Starbucks Locations
summary: REDMOND, Wash., September 03, 2025--NomadGo, the industry leader in Inventory AI, today announced the large-scale deployment of its patented NomadGo Inventory AI in more than 11,000 Starbucks locations across North America. This technology combines computer vision, 3D spatial intelligence, and augmented reality to automate inventory counting using smartphones and tablets—delivering up to eight times faster results than manual methods with 99% accuracy.

headline: Starbucks deploys AI for in-store inventory management
summary: Computer vision is helping the chain keep track of its in-store inventory and may be used to automate some stock ordering.
